title: Baby alligator
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| baby alligator t [![Baby alligator.png](/images/0/07/Baby_alligator.png)](/File:Baby_alligator.png) |                                                                                                          |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A juvenile alligator. While it does not have crushing jaws, nor the strength to put on massive bursts of speed, it is more limber than the adult form, and its milk-tooth is still very sharp.***“Alligators commit errors of diet.” -Bennet Bowler, M.D., \_Contributions to the Natural History of the Alligator, (Crocodilus Mississipiensis), with a Microscopic Addendum\_, p. 17. 1846. |

## Useful Info

**Baby alligators** are small cold-blooded pests that lurk underwater before rushing you with surprising speed, much like a full grown [alligator](/Alligator "Alligator") would. Although they can only deal moderate damage, they may appear in packs, often in the company of a mature alligator. Baby alligators can be found in [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp").

## Tips & Tricks

- All alligators move frighteningly fast when travelling through water, and the Swamp provides few opportunities for limiting the number of units you face at once. If you're not a heavily armoured melee fighter, don't be afraid to [teleport](/Teleport "Teleport") or [blink](/Blink "Blink") to safety if you see a pack closing in on you.

## History

Baby alligators were removed in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
html:
Baby alligator

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
baby alligator t 
HP 26-52
HD 7
XP 265
Speed 12 (swim: 60%)
AC 1
EV 11
Will 20
Attack1 20 (bite: plain)


Resistances rDrown, rWater
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Amphibious
Intelligence Reptile
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Small
Type crocodile, baby alligator
Flags Cold-blooded
Submerges
A juvenile alligator. While it does not have crushing jaws, nor the strength to put on massive bursts of speed, it is more limber than the adult form, and its milk-tooth is still very sharp.

“Alligators commit errors of diet.”
-Bennet Bowler, M.D., _Contributions to the Natural History of the
Alligator, (Crocodilus Mississipiensis), with a Microscopic Addendum_,
p. 17. 1846.

Useful Info

Baby alligators are small cold-blooded pests that lurk underwater before rushing you with surprising speed, much like a full grown alligator would. Although they can only deal moderate damage, they may appear in packs, often in the company of a mature alligator. Baby alligators can be found in the Swamp.

Tips & Tricks

  • All alligators move frighteningly fast when travelling through water, and the Swamp provides few opportunities for limiting the number of units you face at once. If you're not a heavily armoured melee fighter, don't be afraid to teleport or blink to safety if you see a pack closing in on you.

History

Baby alligators were removed in 0.17.
